description.narrative: Improving the system of social protection through the introduction of inclusive quality community-based social services.

participating-org.narrative: MPTFO - Joint SDG Fund (previously known as The Joint Fund for the 2030 Agenda)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Output 1. 1.1. Prototype services are designed and effectiveness measured and costed 1.2. Standards and service specifications are in place including mainstreaming of gender-responsive, child-sensitive and disability inclusive approaches approach 1.3. Indicator number and % of vulnerable population in 5 pilot Etraps covered by services responsive to their needs disaggregated by vulnerability, age, sex Output 2 2.1 Costing and funding standards developed and finalized Output 3 3.1 Number and type of training packages reviewed, consolidated, developed and amended based on evidence from practice

comment.narrative:
1.1 Mainly residential services available; 2300 people with chronic illness in need of home-based social services; no availability of services to support independent living services or personal assistant services for people with disabilities, extremely limited provision of day centre services for adults with disabilities and older people
1.2 Data on costing and funding standards not available
2.1 Draft outline of social worker training package

Output 1 1.1 45 social workers trained and deployed in 15 Etraps for 8 months and assessments of vulnerable target groups completed; inventory of existing social services completed; Design of new social services completed for system and services to fill gaps. 1.2 Standards and service specifications drafted and tested. All SOPs and service specifications designed as gender-responsive, disability inclusive and child-sensitive. 1.3 Number of new services planned for piloting in target etraps. Output 2 2.1. Assessment of costs of existing system and newly designed community-based service model and planned prototype services and cost consequence analysis (or other economic analysis method) to support a case for investment. Output 3 3.1 Five training packages drafted and delivered up to 400 new and existing social service workforce practitioners, managers and allied professionals at national, regional and local levels.

Output 1 1.1. Inventory of existing social services was completed and presented to relevant stakeholders. Training of 45 social workers is under way, to be completed in 2021. Following the foundational phase of training, social workers started work in their places of assignment in between consecutive trainings. Design of new social services was postponed to 2021 due to late start of the JP and COVID-19 mobility restrictions. 1.2. Development of standards and service specifications started with delay due to late start of the relevant JP activities because of COVID-19 mobility restrictions. 1.3. New services are in the process of planning and development due to late start of the relevant JP activities because of COVID-19 mobility restrictions Output 2 2.1. Assessment of costs of existing system and newly designed community-based service model and planned prototype services and cost consequence analysis were postponed to 2021 Output 3 3.1. Since the training programme of Turkmenistan’s social service workforce is designed for 8 months, only the first phase of training of social workers (15 days) was delivered in 2020. This output is expected to be fully achieved by September 2021, following the delivery of the last training package.

Output 1 1.1. Number of new services piloted in target etraps. 1.2. Standards, service specifications and SOPs finalized 1.3. Number of service users who have received services Output 2 2.1. Assessment of costs of existing system and newly designed community-based service model and planned prototype services. Output 3 3.1. Delivery of training packages completed

Output 1 1.1.UNDP is piloting three new specialized social services in the city of Ashgabat through local CSOs that were awarded low-value grants following the competitive selection process. The period of piloting was extended to 31 March 2022, following the extension of UNDP participation in the Joint Programme. 1.2.All relevant standards and service specifications were developed, adopted and finalized for provision of new specialized social services. SOPs are in the process of development and to be finalized by early March 2022. 1.3. 131 people from vulnerable groups, including people with official status of disability, elderly people living alone and people with chronic illnesses (of which 84 are women) currently receive new specialized social services in their places of residence on the basis of individual plans with the support of personal assistants.
Output 2 2.1. The socio-economic analysis of new and traditional social services is currently under way and to be completed by the end of February 2022. The late start of the analysis was due to the overall delay in launching pilot social services by all JP PUNOs.
Output 3 3.1. A comprehensive package of training materials consisting of 7 modules has been prepared for short-term in-service certification courses on the fundamentals and core functions of social work. This package was developed by the Bulgarian Social Activities and Practice Institute and delivered online to 10 national trainers, who then cascaded the training in face-to-face format to 297 new and existing social service practitioners, including the freshly recruited 45 social workers, 79 representatives of allied workforces, 106 managers of social work, 67 representatives of social service providers across the country, throughout all regions and the capital. In total, 113 days of person-training were provided. Overall, the capacity building training not only helped develop competencies of social service practitioners and para-professionals in social service provision but also provided a platform for introduction of the proposed model to the relevant stakeholders and reinforcing the cross-sectoral collaboration for effective implementation of the set objectives.

Output 1
1.1. Number of new services piloted in target etraps. 1.2. Standards, service specifications and SOPs finalized 1.3. Number of service users who have received services
Output 2 2.1. Assessment of costs of existing system and newly designed community-based service model and planned prototype services finalized and presented to key national stakeholders.
